issues.title: Missing Gun-Free Schools Act Federal Reporting Requirement
issues.description: Federal law requires districts to report firearm expulsions to the state, but neither the policy nor regulation addresses this mandatory reporting requirement to comply with the Gun-Free Schools Act.

legal_citations.text: Each State receiving Federal funds under this Act shall have in effect a State law requiring local educational agencies to expel from school for a period of not less than 1 year a student who is determined to have brought a firearm to a school... Each State shall report to the Secretary on the implementation of this section.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall report to the California Department of Education any expulsion of a student for bringing a firearm to school as required by the Gun-Free Schools Act.

issues.title: Missing Specific Law Enforcement Notification Timeline
issues.description: While the policy states law enforcement must be notified when students possess weapons, it lacks the specific 24-hour reporting requirement mandated by California law for certain weapon violations.

legal_citations.text: The principal of a school or the principal's designee shall, prior to the suspension or expulsion of any pupil, notify the appropriate law enforcement authorities of the county or city in which the school is situated of any acts of the pupil that may violate Section 245 of the Penal Code.

issues.required_language: Law enforcement notification shall occur immediately, but no later than 24 hours after discovery of the weapon possession or assault with a weapon incident.

issues.title: Missing Mandatory Expulsion Offenses List Compliance
issues.description: The policy references mandatory expulsion for firearms but doesn't clearly align with Education Code 48915's complete list of mandatory expulsion offenses involving weapons, which includes brandishing a knife and explosive devices.

legal_citations.text: A pupil shall be recommended for expulsion for... (2) Brandishing a knife at another person. (3) Unlawfully selling a controlled substance... (4) Committing or attempting to commit a sexual assault or committing a sexual battery...

issues.required_language: Students shall be recommended for expulsion for: (1) possessing, selling, or furnishing a firearm; (2) brandishing a knife at another person; (3) possessing an explosive device. The Board may consider each case individually and may modify the expulsion requirement on a case-by-case basis.

issues.title: Missing Reference to Penal Code 626.9 Specifics
issues.description: While the policy cites Penal Code 626.9, it doesn't specify the enhanced penalties and specific prohibitions for bringing firearms onto school grounds that this code establishes.

legal_citations.text: Any person who possesses a firearm in a place that the person knows, or reasonably should know, is a school zone... is guilty of a felony.

issues.required_language: Possession of firearms on school grounds may constitute a felony under Penal Code 626.9, and violators may be subject to criminal prosecution in addition to school disciplinary action.

issues.title: Missing Documentation and Record Retention Requirements
issues.description: The regulation lacks specific requirements for documenting weapon incidents and maintaining records as required for compliance monitoring and potential legal proceedings.

legal_citations.text: Documentation of incidents and disciplinary actions must be maintained in accordance with student record requirements.

issues.required_language: All weapon-related incidents shall be documented in writing, including witness statements, evidence collected, and actions taken. Records shall be maintained in accordance with student disciplinary record retention requirements.
